title: Alternative for Poplar
content:
Hi Typophiles,

I am looking for a font that can be used next to the Poplar, with simular characteristics but more weights etc.  
Anyone has an idea??

Thanks in advance!  
Queneau
author: Queneau

comments.content:
Hi,

similar to Poplar–  
Woodgrit Heavy  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/baseline/woodgrit\_heavy/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425041904/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/baseline/woodgrit_heavy/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/baseline/woodgrit\_heavy/")  
FF Kipp  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Kipp&x=0&y=0](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425041904/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Kipp&x=0&y=0 "http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Kipp&x=0&y=0")  
and as a Egyptienne partner  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Behemoth&x=0&y=0](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425041904/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Behemoth&x=0&y=0 "http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Behemoth&x=0&y=0")

more weights –  
Woodgrit  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=woodgrit&x=18&y=8](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425041904/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=woodgrit&x=18&y=8 "http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=woodgrit&x=18&y=8")

PS It's good to have Fontbook for this kind of search …

The woodgrit is very good for what I'd like to use it for!

Thanks a lot!
